question: Which among the following is true regarding amendments of the constitution with provisions which affect the federal character of the constitution?
option1: They can be amended by a simple majority
option2: They can be amended by a 2/3 majority of both the houses of parliament
option3: They can be amended by not only a 2/3 majority of the parliament but also ratification by at least 1/2 of the states
answer: They can be amended by not only a 2/3 majority of the parliament but also ratification by at least 1/2 of the states
explanation: The amendments which affect the federal character of the constitution need to be passed by special majority of the parliament and also need ratification by half of the State Legislatures.
